oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dark Horse Theater, 2000 December
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of the Dark Horse Theater, formerly West Nashville Presbyterian Church. The building is located at 4610 Charlotte Avenue, in Nashville, Tennessee. Early city directories listed the address as 4608 Charlotte Avenue. The building has been in use as a theater since approximately 1990. The foundation is made of rough cut, unfinished stone. The exterior walls are red brick. The roof is gabled with tar shingles, and flat at the rear. The windows are arched with frosted glass panes. The doors are metal and wood. Special architectural features include four columns. Forms part of the Historic Nashville, Inc. Sacred Sites Survey Project. 1 photograph : col. ; 4 x 6 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: West Nashville Presbyterian Church (Tenn.); Dark Horse Theater (Nashville, Tenn.)
